docs.snippet: Poland threatened to halt the transfer of al Qaeda suspects to a secret CIA jail on its soil 11 years ago, but became more "flexible" after the Central Intelligence Agency gave it a large sum of money, according to a U.S. Senate report....

headline.main: CIA Paid Poland to Ease Qualms Over Secret Prison: Senate Report
headline.print_headline: CIA Paid Poland to Ease Qualms Over Secret Prison: Senate Report

docs.lead_paragraph: Poland threatened to halt the transfer of al Qaeda suspects to a secret CIA jail on its soil 11 years ago, but became more "flexible" after the Central Intelligence Agency gave it a large sum of money, according to a U.S. Senate report.

docs.snippet: Over half of the nation's high-poverty schools are taking advantage of a new federal initiative intended to make it easier for U.S. children to eat nutritious cafeteria meals for free, federal officials said on Tuesday....

docs.snippet: Writer-director Chris Rock is not Andre Allen, the stand-up comedian turned movie star lead of "Top Five." But, it's almost impossible to watch his latest effort, a cutting comedy about showbiz, creativity and ambition, and not wonder what materia...

headline.main: Review: Chris Rock's Stand-Up Comes to Life in 'Top Five'
headline.print_headline: Review: Chris Rock's Stand-Up Comes to Life in 'Top Five'

docs.lead_paragraph: Writer-director Chris Rock is not Andre Allen, the stand-up comedian turned movie star lead of "Top Five." But, it's almost impossible to watch his latest effort, a cutting comedy about showbiz, creativity and ambition, and not wonder what material Rock took from his own life. While that's a fun and compelling draw, thankfully, it's only part of the triumph of the film. In "Top Five," Rock manages to transcend the gimmick and his larger-than-life persona, to create one of the most vibrant, self-aware comedies of the year.

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said Tuesday that the U.S. has offered to help Mexico figure out what happened to 43 college students who have been missing since September, but he stopped short of saying that aid to the U.S. ally and neighbor should be rec...

headline.main: Obama: US Offers Mexico Help on Missing Students
headline.print_headline: Obama: US Offers Mexico Help on Missing Students

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Tuesday that the U.S. has offered to help Mexico figure out what happened to 43 college students who have been missing since September, but he stopped short of saying that aid to the U.S. ally and neighbor should be reconsidered on the basis of the country's human rights record.

docs.snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry on Tuesday told Congress that an authorization of use of military force (A.U.M.F.) against the Islamic State should not restrict military operations to Syria and Iraq....

headline.main: Kerry Requests Use of Military Force

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry on Tuesday told Congress that an authorization of use of military force (A.U.M.F.) against the Islamic State should not restrict military operations to Syria and Iraq.

docs.snippet: In a story Dec. 9, The Associated Press reported that Columbia Law School officials had urged students protesting a lack of grand jury indictments of white police officers involved in the deaths of unarmed black men to remain focused on the seriou...

headline.main: Clarification: Killings By Police-Law Schools Story
headline.print_headline: Clarification: Killings By Police-Law Schools Story

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 9, The Associated Press reported that Columbia Law School officials had urged students protesting a lack of grand jury indictments of white police officers involved in the deaths of unarmed black men to remain focused on the serious issues the cases raise. The story should have made clear a Columbia Law School statement urged the public to remain focused on the issues.
